Title: UBEC tasks states on $500m education grant
Summary: UBEC tasks states on $500m education grant . State governments have been challenged to be pragmatic in meeting the requirements for accessing the funds . The funds are meant for the development of basic education .

Title: Children’s Day: Lagos commits to zero HIV births
Summary: Lagos State Government has reiterated commitment to achieving zero HIV births across the state . The state marks the 2025 Children's Day with intensified efforts to prevent mother-to-child transmission of HIV .

Title: ‘Libraries remain vital learning hubs for academic excellence’
Summary: Vice Chancellor of the National Open University of Nigeria (NOUN), Prof. Olufemi Peters, has underscored the importance of libraries as vital learning hubs . Peters calls for awareness among academics on their continued relevance .

Title: One million digital jobs target and struggling telecom sector
Summary: Tomorrow, May 29, it will be exactly two years since President Bola Ahmed Tinubu took the oath of office . He promised to create one million digital jobs for Nigeria's burgeoning youth population .

Title: ‘Political conflicts strain institutions,  undermine  governance in Rivers’
Summary: Rivers State Administrator, Vice Admiral Ibok-Ete Ekwe Ibas (rtd) lamented that political conflicts in Rivers State have strained institutions and undermined governance in the state . He said, despite huge resources, the state is lacking on multiple fronts .

Title: NAFDAC intensifies efforts to strengthen Pharmacovigilance in Nigeria
Summary: Nigeria has taken a significant step toward improving its pharmacovigilance system . NAFDAC intensifies efforts to enhance patient safety and close gaps in adverse drug reaction (ADR) reporting .

Title: ’Over 570 illegal refining sites demobilized, 681 suspects arrested in Niger Delta in 5 months’

Title: VIDEO: 'Nigerians are used to easy money,' Orji Kalu defends Tinubu’s economic reforms
Summary: Senator representing Abia North, Orji Uzor Kalu, has defended the economic policies of President Bola Tinubu .
